result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew James Jacobs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew James Jacobs

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reason for Change: Terminated - Regular.             Restitution = $0.00, Court Obs = $0.00 and Supv fees = $40.00. eif

E: DOC, DA, Def, Atty Hertel, Jail and SCSO. mw
Copy of letter from Atty Hertel to ADA Hartung. mw

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Hertel  DF: Andrew James Jacobs appeared. Case called at 11:53. Includes 12CF282, 14CF24. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Court amend count 1 in 14CF24 to Misd. Bail Jump.  DE pleads G to Ct 1 in 14CF24 amended to Misd bail jump and Ct. 3 in 12CF282. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty to the amended Ct 1 in 14CF24 and Ct. 3 in 12CF282. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1, 2 in 12CF282. Sentencing arguments. Court waives PSI.  ADA Hartung received a correspondence and reviews it with the court. 

Crt orders:  
14CF24 - amended count 1  
S/W 1 years probation - concurrent with count 3 of 12CF 282. 
-  costs and DNA surcharge


12CF282 - count 3
Counts 1 & 2 dismissed.
S/W 3 year probation  - concurrent with count 1 of 14CF24
- costs and DNA surcharge
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Regular and random testing, at the discretion of agent
- maintain current mental health and addiction treatment
-  Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting. Except in a treatment setting.
-  Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-  120 hours of community service, 40 hours each year.
-  DNA sample  
-  6 months conditional jail time - Stayed. 
- pay supervision fees.

No credit toward ultimate sentence.

Defendant to report to probation today, 8-19-15, before 4:00 pm.  Defendant may transfer probation to the State of Illinois.
Return on warrant at 08-19-2015 03:00 pm

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Matthew Hartung  DF ATTY:  Harry R Hertel   DF:  Andrew James Jacobs did not appear. Includes 14CF24 and 12CF282. Case called at 2:25 p.m. Atty. Hertel states there is a plea agreement. ADA Hartung agrees. Court sets plea hearing and issues warrant STAYED.  Return on warrant scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Hertel will work on the plea questionaire with DE, the DE will have one in front of him during the next hearing. DE will be able to appear in person if it is after April 15, 2015.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Court approves video conferencing if needed. If DE is out of custody DE must appear in person. Bond continues.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Cross by Atty Cogbill 3:37 p.m. Redirect. Arguments by attorneys. States brief due by 9-12-14. DE's response due by 9-26-14. State's reply due by 10-6-14. Court sets for oral ruling. Bond continues in form and amount. Adjourned at 3:54 p.m.  Oral ruling scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
